title: Unsupported 16-bit Application

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body:
I have tried,

- Reinstalling
- Repairing
- Running as administrator
- Restarting my PC

The error still remains. It just pops up after I hit launch even after I install the client over and over again. The problem just started happening today.

Specs:   

Operating System: Windows 7 Professional 64-bit (6.1, Build 7601) Service Pack 1 (7601.win7sp1_rtm.101119-1850)
           Language: English (Regional Setting: English)
System Manufacturer: Alienware
       System Model: M17xR4
               BIOS: InsydeH2O Version 03.72.24A12
          Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-3630QM CPU @ 2.40GHz (8 CPUs), ~2.4GHz
             Memory: 16384MB RAM
Available OS Memory: 16266MB RAM
          Page File: 6969MB used, 25561MB available
        Windows Dir: C:\Windows
    DirectX Version: DirectX 11
DX Setup Parameters: Not found
   User DPI Setting: Using System DPI
 System DPI Setting: 96 DPI (100 percent)
    DWM DPI Scaling: Disabled
     DxDiag Version: 6.01.7601.17514 32bit Unicode


FYI, since Windows Update stopped releasing Windows 7 updates I cannot update them. At least from what I've known. I've tried installing the files on my own, but it still doesn't fix the issues with other games who need Windows Updates. I'm wondering if this is the same problem, if so I guess I'm going to have to sink down and buy another operating system.

replies.body:
Your build version of Windows 7 is **really out of date**. This will cause massive issues for League, such as the one you're experiencing now. I strongly recommend reaching out to a local computer shop or Alienware Support, if your PC is still under any sort of support plan or warranty.

If you have any other issues with this after you've installed all current windows updates, let me know.

Hey,

That's really odd error, are you sure you don't have any viruses/malware on your computer?

I recommend doing full computer scan using Avast: https://www.avast.com/en-gb/index

For malware scan i recommend Malwarebytes: https://www.malwarebytes.com/mwb-download/thankyou/
